exercises.description: Step forward into a forward lunge with both feet pointing straight ahead. Slowly lower your back knee toward the floor as you rotate your hips and trunk toward the front leg. Pause briefly at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position while rotating back to neutral.

external_cues: Check that both feet point straight forward before each rep.
Use a side support (chair/counter) as needed.
Visually confirm the front knee tracks straight over the toes.
Watch that your torso rotates toward the front leg during the descent.
Check that your torso stays upright, not leaning forward or backward.
motor_cues: Move like an elevator - straight down, straight up.
Rotate toward the lead leg as you go down, return to neutral as you come up.
Push through the front heel to rise.
Lightly tighten the front glute as you press up to support the SI joints.
Keep pelvis level; imagine the hip bones as two headlights pointing forward.
compensation_warnings: If the back foot turns outward, reset.
If the front knee collapses inward, reduce depth or rotation.
If your torso tilts sideways, pause and re-establish the upright elevator line.
If your pelvis drifts forward or backward instead of staying stacked, use more support.
safety_flags: Stop if SI discomfort increases with rotation.
Stop if pelvic alignment repeatedly shifts and cannot be corrected.
Stop if the support hand becomes weight-bearing instead of stabilizing.

exercises.description: Lie on your back with your legs straight and hip-width apart, with a strap secured around your legs. Turn your toes inward to reduce SI strain and maintain a pelvic tuck. Press outward into the strap from the hips while keeping your legs straight. Hold the outward pressure for the required time, then release and repeat.

external_cues: Check that legs begin straight and hip-width apart.
Rotate toes inward before pressing outward.
Visually confirm feet stay pointing upward, not drifting outward.
Ensure even pressure into the strap on both sides.
motor_cues: Press outward from the hips while keeping legs long.
Maintain a pelvic tuck (back flat).
Relax your glutes at rest; engage only as needed to stabilize.
Breathe steadily through the hold.
compensation_warnings: If your feet rotate outward, pause and reset to the inward-start position.
Avoid lifting or bending your legs; keep them long and straight.
Avoid tensing your back muscles — outward pressure should come from the hips.
Avoid shifting more pressure into one leg; keep the strap evenly loaded.
safety_flags: Stop if SI pressure develops within the first few seconds of the hold.
Stop if feet repeatedly rotate outward despite correction.

exercises.description: Sit upright with knees spaced to support the stability ball. Lightly place fingertips on the ball at the marked depth point. With your back straight and pelvis in your hinge position, hinge forward from the hips until the ball reaches upright orientation. Return to tall sitting without shifting your weight or pelvis.

external_cues: Sit tall and confirm your feet point forward.
Lightly rest fingertips on the correct ring of the ball.
Watch the ball’s inflation plug rotate upright as you hinge.
Ensure your pelvis stays level and does not shift.
motor_cues: Hinge forward from the hips only.
Maintain a neutral spine and pelvic tilt.
Keep your sit bones anchored to the chair.
Return upright by engaging hips, not by lifting the chest first.
compensation_warnings: Avoid rounding your back.
Avoid glute lift-off.
Avoid knees collapsing inward.
safety_flags: Stop if pelvic shifting cannot be corrected.

exercises.canonical_name: Supine 90/90 Ball Squeeze With Hip Internal Rotation
exercises.description: Lie on your back with legs in 90/90 and a small ball between your knees. Keep toes pointed upward and maintain a pelvic tuck. Squeeze the ball and rotate your legs outward from the hips while keeping thighs steady and the 90/90 position unchanged. Return to center and repeat.

external_cues: Ensure your hips and knees are in a 90/90 position with shins vertical.
Visually confirm that your feet point straight upward (vertical) at the start and throughout the movement.
Maintain a pelvic tuck (back flat).
Maintain even squeeze on the ball.
motor_cues: Rotate both legs outward from the hips, not from the feet.
Keep the pelvic tuck the entire time.
Maintain a steady squeeze on the ball.
compensation_warnings: Avoid arching your back or losing the pelvic tuck.
safety_flags: Stop if feet repeatedly rotate inward or outward.

exercises.description: Lie on your side with your body in a straight line, then bend your knees to 90 degrees. Position your elbow slightly forward of your torso with padding if needed. Lift hips until your shoulders and knees form a straight line, adjusting elbow position so the shoulder stacks over it. Lower with control and repeat.

external_cues: Line up head, trunk, hips, and knees before bending the knees to 90°.
Place elbow slightly under torso, with padding as needed.
Once lifted, check shoulder is stacked over elbow.
Confirm straight line from shoulders to knees at the top.
motor_cues: Brace core and gently tuck pelvis before lifting.
Lift hips by pressing through the forearm.
Keep shoulder blades gently drawn back.
Lower hips with control.
compensation_warnings: Avoid letting shoulder roll forward or collapsing.
Avoid bending at the hips into a V shape.
Avoid head dropping toward the floor.
Avoid rotating torso toward ceiling or floor.
safety_flags: Stop if shoulder, neck, or low-back pain develops.
Stop if elbow discomfort persists despite padding.
Stop if you cannot maintain alignment.

exercises.description: Place foot against edge of step. Lean forward slightly and push heel down until you feel a strong stretch in the back of the leg. Do not bend knee.

external_cues: Strong stretch in calf, possibly ankle.
compensation_warnings: Do not arch or round the low back.
Do not bend the knees to increase the stretch.

exercises.description: Stand with one foot positioned so the heel of the front foot is positioned at the toes of the back foot (or at the current working distance). Arms in Romberg position. Eyes closed. Hold the position without stepping.

external_cues: Keep hips level as the body makes small adjustments.
Keep shoulders stacked over hips as balance shifts.
compensation_warnings: Do not hinge forward at the hips.
Do not rotate through the pelvis or low back.
Avoid gripping the toes or locking the knees.
safety_flags: Perform near a wall or stable surface.
Stop if dizziness, nausea, or loss of balance occurs.

exercises.description: While standing, lift the forefoot off the ground. Place a 9 inch ball at the outside of the foot. Push the outside of the foot into the ball and hold the contraction. Perform one foot at a time.

external_cues: Lift the forefoot off the ground before pressing.
Keep the heel planted.
Press the outside of the foot straight into the ball without rolling the ankle.
compensation_warnings: Do not let the knee collapse inward or outward.
Do not twist the pelvis or trunk.
Avoid using the hip or back to generate force.
safety_flags: Discontinue if knee pain or ankle pain increases.
Perform seated if standing causes knee irritation.

exercises.description: While seated, place feet flat on the ground. Lift toes and rotate ankles so toes point outward. Lower toes to ground and rotate ankles to bring feet back to original starting point. Keep heels stationary.

external_cues: Keep heels fully in contact with the floor.
Rotate feet from the ankles, not the knees or hips.
Keep knees facing straight forward.
compensation_warnings: Do not let knees fall inward or outward.
Do not rotate through the hips or low back.
Avoid leaning the trunk or shifting weight.
safety_flags: Stop if low back or SI joint pain increases.

exercises.description: Stand on a step with one leg supporting your weight and the opposite leg extended forward. Bend the supporting knee to lower your body and lightly tap the heel of the free leg to the floor. Do not transfer weight. Return to standing with control.

motor_cues: Control both lowering and return.
Keep torso upright.
Tap lightly with the heel only.
compensation_warnings: Avoid leaning forward.
Avoid shifting weight to the tapping leg.

exercises.description: Stand with a resistance band around the ankles and feet hip-width apart. Slightly bend the knees and keep toes pointing forward. Step sideways with control while maintaining band tension and upright posture. Complete all steps in one direction before reversing.

motor_cues: Keep toes pointing straight ahead.
Maintain upright posture.
Maintain band tension throughout.
compensation_warnings: Avoid shuffling or dragging the feet.
Avoid leaning or rotating the torso.

exercises.description: Lie on your side with hips and knees bent and a resistance band just above the knees. Keep hips stacked and feet together. Lift the top knee without allowing the pelvis to roll back. Pause briefly, then lower with control. Complete all repetitions on one side before switching.

motor_cues: Keep hips stacked and stable.
Do not roll the pelvis backward.
compensation_warnings: Avoid rocking or rotating the pelvis.
Do not separate the feet.

exercises.description: Lie on your side with the bottom leg straight and an ankle weight on the bottom ankle. Bend the top leg and place the foot on the floor in front of the bottom knee. Slowly lift the bottom leg up to your controlled limit, then lower with control.

motor_cues: Lift and lower slowly with control.
compensation_warnings: Avoid rolling the pelvis.

exercises.canonical_name: Supine Hamstring Isometric Heel Dig With Swiss Ball
exercises.description: Lie on your back with the working heel on a swiss ball and the knee bent. The other leg is in hooklying to guide the ball. Press the heel down into the ball, then pull the ball back toward you until the knee approaches 90 degrees and hold. Push the ball forward to reset and repeat. Keep the leg in line with the body, glutes relaxed, and core engaged with pelvic tuck.

motor_cues: Keep core engaged with pelvic tuck.
Keep foot neutral (do not flex).
Pull back and hold without shifting the pelvis.
compensation_warnings: Avoid glute gripping.
Avoid twisting or letting the leg drift out of line.

exercises.description: Stand on the right leg with support available on the right side. Slightly bend the right knee. Reach with the left foot to tap: forward, diagonal-forward, left, diagonal-back, and straight-back. Use heel/side/toe contact as needed to avoid twisting. Keep torso facing forward.

motor_cues: Bend the stance knee only as much as needed to reach.
Keep pelvis and torso facing forward; reach from the hip.
Use heel/side/toe contact as instructed to prevent twisting.
compensation_warnings: Do not twist through the knee or pelvis.
Avoid letting the stance knee move far forward over the toes.

exercises.description: Stand upright holding an object with a marked target in both hands, arms fully extended. Keep eyes locked on the target. Move the object in a large circle overhead and down across the upper body. Perform reps in both directions.

external_cues: Keep eyes locked on the marked target the entire time.
motor_cues: Move smoothly through the circle.
Keep arms straight.
safety_flags: Stop if dizziness becomes excessive or balance becomes unsafe.

exercises.description: Stand tall facing a table or support surface. Wearing ankle weights, slowly raise both heels until you are on your toes. Pause briefly, then slowly lower with control. Use hands for balance only.

motor_cues: Lift and lower slowly with control.
Pause briefly at the top.
compensation_warnings: Avoid bouncing.
Avoid shifting weight side-to-side.

exercises.description: Lie on your back with hips and knees at 90 degrees and arms up. Place a swiss ball lightly between hands and knees. Maintain a posterior pelvic tuck. Lower the opposite arm and leg together until both touch down, then return them together. Alternate sides.

motor_cues: Maintain posterior pelvic tuck throughout.
Keep contact with the ball without hard pressing.
Arm and opposite leg touch down simultaneously, and return together.
compensation_warnings: Avoid arching the low back.
Avoid pelvic shift or rotation.

exercises.canonical_name: Forward Lunge With Rotation And Swiss Ball (Wall)
exercises.description: Stand in split stance with a swiss ball between the outside of the front knee and a wall. Lower into a lunge as deep as controlled while rotating toward the front leg and pressing the front knee into the ball. Pause, then rise and rotate back to neutral. Repeat without resetting stance, then switch sides.

motor_cues: Drop straight down; keep both feet pointing straight ahead.
Press through the front heel to rise.
Rotate toward the front leg on the way down; rotate back to neutral on the way up.
compensation_warnings: Avoid torso lean or twisting through the pelvis.
Monitor rear foot/ankle for discomfort.

exercises.description: Stand with feet hip-width apart. Stay upright over your base. Shift weight slightly to one leg. Move the other foot inward (slightly crossing in front), then sweep it forward and outward in a wide arc. Land with the foot flat and keep toes pointing straight ahead. Use resistance band as directed. Repeat, alternating sides.

motor_cues: Keep toes and feet pointed straight ahead throughout.
Land with the foot flat with even pressure through the midfoot.
Stay upright—do not lean back or reach the foot forward.
Maintain outward knee pressure against the band if used.
compensation_warnings: Avoid letting the band pull the moving foot inward.
Avoid knee collapse inward.
Avoid shifting weight behind you.

exercises.description: Stand tall near a stair railing or counter. Shift weight fully onto one leg and lift the opposite foot completely off the ground, keeping the knee bent. Maintain upright posture and a level pelvis throughout the hold.

motor_cues: Lift the foot completely—no toe contact.
Keep the lifted knee bent and the leg relaxed.
Engage glutes and core to keep the pelvis level.
compensation_warnings: Avoid leaning toward the stance leg.
Use the railing/counter for safety, not support.

exercises.description: Stand with your back flat against a wall and feet shoulder-width apart. Slide down the wall by bending the knees until thighs are parallel to the floor or as low as comfortable. Keep knees aligned over ankles. Push through the heels to return to standing.

motor_cues: Keep feet pointing straight ahead.
Press evenly through both heels.
compensation_warnings: Avoid knees drifting inward.

exercises.description: Stand facing a step. Place one foot fully on the step and keep it there throughout the movement. Press through the foot on the step to lift your body upward. The opposite foot taps or pauses briefly on the step, then returns to the floor. Move with control.

motor_cues: Press through the foot on the step.
Keep torso upright.
Pause briefly at the top.
compensation_warnings: Avoid using momentum.
Avoid knee collapse inward.

exercises.description: Stand with a small (9 inch) ball between a wall or similar sturdy surface and the inside of the foot. Lift the forefoot. Rotate at the ankle and press the side of the foot into the ball. Hold.
